title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 28 February 2014 - XWiki
content:

08:07 <vmassol> has quit  
08:08 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:11 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
08:12 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:13 <UCC> has quit  
08:16 <polx> has quit  
08:18 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
08:26 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
08:41 <andreeapopescu> has joined #xwiki  
08:48 <vmassol> hi Denis  
08:49 <vmassol> I see some build errors which could have been caused by the security move of yesterday. For example: http://teamcity.xwiki.org/viewLog.html?buildId=50&buildTypeId=XWikiPlatform\_Default&tab=buildLog#\_state=21&focus=81  
08:49 <vmassol> any idea?  
08:50 <Denis> vmassol: Hi, I can reach that link, I need credentials  
08:50 <vmassol> Denis: actually you don't  
08:50 <Denis> s/can/can't  
08:50 <vmassol> just click on guest  
08:50 <Denis> ok, very small, not seen it  
08:50 <vmassol> nobody sees it, very bad uix  
08:51 <Denis> vmassol: have you build common first ?  
08:51 <vmassol> no idea  
08:51 <vmassol> yes  
08:51 <vmassol> it was just checked  
08:51 <Denis> since the version of those deps have been moved to commons  
08:51 <vmassol> commons was built 8 hours ago  
08:51 <vmassol> and platform 8 minutes ago  
08:53 <vmassol> what maven says it's that it cannot find the version specified for org.bouncycastle:bcprov-jdk15  
08:54 <Denis> that one is now in the commons pom  
08:55 <vmassol> checking locally  
08:55 <UCC> has joined #xwiki  
08:55 <vmassol> yep same  
08:55 <vmassol> so it's a real issue  
08:56 <Denis> I have check locally yesterday, and it has worked for me, I wonder why  
08:56 <vmassol> because you've manually built the top level commons pon maybe  
08:57 <unknown\_\_> has joined #xwiki  
08:57 <vmassol> to reproduce remove the xwiki artifacts form your local repo and try building xwiki-platform/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-office/xwiki-platform-office-importer for example  
08:57 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
08:58 <Denis> what is the problem with installing those top level manually ?  
08:59 <vmassol> the build is failing  
08:59 <vmassol> that's the problem :)  
08:59 <Denis> (if I don't, maven complains that the pom where invalid)  
08:59 <vmassol> our maven build can be run from any module without the need to have anything in your local repo  
08:59 <Denis> I do not get the issue right now, if you do, could you explains ?  
09:00 <vmassol> have you done what I said?  
09:00 <vmassol> "to reproduce remove the xwiki artifacts form your local repo and try building xwiki-platform/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-office/xwiki-platform-office-importer for example"  
09:00 <vmassol> s/form/from  
09:00 <UCC> has quit  
09:00 <vmassol> now I don't understand the problem ATM  
09:01 <vmassol> if I knew the problem I'd fix it, still trying to understand what's wrong  
09:01 <Denis> I have moved the dependency management for those deps from platfom pom to commons pom  
09:01 <vmassol> I know what you did  
09:01 <Denis> if commons poms does not get deployed, platform cannot build anymore, obviously  
09:02 <vmassol> that's the reason why we have a CI  
09:02 <vmassol> so let's check that  
09:02 <vmassol> maybe jenkins was down and didn't deploy the top level pom  
09:02 <Denis> we have 2 CI actually  
09:02 <vmassol> no  
09:02 <vmassol> only 1 pushes stuff to the maven remote repo  
09:02 <vmassol> (that's jenkinsà  
09:02 <vmassol> )  
09:02 <Denis> do you mean, Jenkins should do the job ?  
09:02 <vmassol> the other one (TC) is not operational yet  
09:03 <Denis> if so, the issue is simple, Jenkins has not build commons  
09:03 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Commons/job/xwiki-commons/ seems to have worked  
09:03 <Denis> have juste launch it just before you ask me  
09:03 <vmassol> so the commons artifacts must have been pushed  
09:03 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
09:03 <vmassol> ah  
09:03 <vmassol> hmm  
09:03 <vmassol> so for some reason  
09:03 <vmassol> it didn't get triggered  
09:03 <vmassol> since I see changes in your manual trigger  
09:04 <vmassol> see http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Commons/job/xwiki-commons/1243/  
09:04 <vmassol> maybe our CI was in a bad shape  
09:04 <vmassol> and thus didn't build it  
09:04 <vmassol> and then we had a cron restart the CI  
09:04 <Denis> Jenkins seems absolutely unreliable currently  
09:04 <vmassol> yes  
09:05 <Denis> is your experiment with TC conclusive ?  
09:05 <vmassol> not yet  
09:05 <vmassol> it's still not full configured  
09:05 <vmassol> and we need to use it for real  
09:06 <vmassol> first step is to make it build everything correctly  
09:06 <Denis> for sure, but according to what I see from Jenkins, it could not be worse :)  
09:06 <vmassol> it is  
09:06 <vmassol> it doesn't build everything  
09:06 <vmassol> (yet)  
09:06 <vmassol> so that's slightly worse :)  
09:06 <Denis> really, Jenkins has build nothing from my changes  
09:06 <Denis> could it be worse ?  
09:07 <Denis> while TC have failed due to Jenkins, BTW !  
09:07 <vmassol> I can have TC push to our remote maven repo  
09:07 <vmassol> I was hesitating because of the conflict that can be caused by this  
09:08 <Denis> for sure, this could be an issue  
09:09 <vmassol> hmm tC failed again  
09:09 <vmassol> I wonder why  
09:09 <Denis> all I said finaly, is that we do not trust Jenkins much, your recent ML thread confirm that  
09:10 <Denis> does TC get the latest pom or does it used the cached ones ?  
09:10 <vmassol> BTW we still don't have a license for TC, jetbrains haven't replied yet  
09:10 <vmassol> it's supposed to use the latest one  
09:10 <vmassol> I've configured it with -U  
09:11 <Denis> looking at the logs, it does not  
09:11 <vmassol> looking at the logs it does :)  
09:11 <vmassol> search for -U  
09:11 <Denis> pom was from 07:46:20  
09:12 <vmassol> and you can see it says:  
09:12 <vmassol> Downloading: http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/content/groups/public-snapshots/org/xwiki/commons/xwiki-commons-pom/6.0-SNAPSHOT/maven-metadata.xml  
09:12 <vmassol> in here: http://teamcity.xwiki.org/viewLog.html?buildId=51&buildTypeId=XWikiPlatform\_Default&tab=buildLog  
09:12 <Denis> Downloaded: http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/content/groups/public-snapshots/org/xwiki/commons/xwiki-commons-pom/6.0-SNAPSHOT/xwiki-commons-pom-6.0-20140228.074620-22.pom  
09:12 <Denis> 07:46:20  
09:13 <vmassol> that's the latest  
09:13 <vmassol> http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/commons/xwiki-commons/6.0-SNAPSHOT/  
09:13 <Denis> yep, its GMT  
09:13 <Denis> sorry  
09:13 <Denis> but not the right pom we need :)  
09:14 <vmassol> why not? http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/commons/xwiki-commons/6.0-SNAPSHOT/xwiki-commons-6.0-20140228.074603-22.pom seems good  
09:15 <vmassol> (it has bcprov in it)  
09:15 <Denis> yep, that the right one  
09:15 <vmassol> actually  
09:16 <vmassol> the problem is a different one than before now  
09:16 <vmassol> it's no longer about bcprov  
09:16 <vmassol> well  
09:16 <vmassol> there's still the message at the top...  
09:16 <vmassol> but that's normal  
09:16 <vmassol> that's before the download  
09:16 <vmassol> so this one can be discarded I believe  
09:17 <vmassol> trigging again  
09:18 <vmassol> brb (10mn)  
09:18 <Denis> ok  
09:30 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
09:37 <vmassol> back  
09:40 <Denis> the problem in your build was on platform before my commit now  
09:41 <Denis> you may see it on Jenkins  
09:41 <vmassol> now it doesn't find the license plugin  
09:41 <vmassol> but I don't know why  
09:41 <vmassol> actually everytime I triger a build I get a differenr result :(  
09:41 <vmassol> latest : http://teamcity.xwiki.org/viewLog.html?buildId=53&buildTypeId=XWikiPlatform\_Default&tab=buildLog  
09:42 <Denis> (I was talking about the xwiki-platform-legacy-rendering-macro-include  
09:42 <vmassol> seems to be building now  
09:42 <vmassol> with warnings at the top but still running  
09:42 <vmassol> weird that I had to trigger the build 3 times with no changes to make it work  
09:44 <vmassol> fixiing relativepath issue in legacy rendering  
09:44 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:46 <Denis> vmassol: could it be a spurious network issue ?  
09:46 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
09:46 <vmassol> maybe...  
09:46 <Denis> it was trying a download that have simply failed  
09:47 <vmassol> ah ok interestig  
09:49 <Denis> Apart from the login, the UI of TC looks promising and far more readable IMO, hope you will get a license soon…  
10:07 <Denis> mflorea: while upgrading subwikis from 5.4.1 to 5.4.2 using the DW from mainwiki, I got a warn about "Failed to load job status for id [[extension, action, org.xwiki.enterprise:xwiki-enterprise-ui-wiki, wiki:<wikiname>]]", followed by a stacktrace, this does not seems to me expected, isn't it ?  
10:09 <unknown\_\_> has quit  
10:11 <mflorea> Denis: no, it's not expected, we had a couple of issues with the library that serializes and reads the job status, I know Thomas fixed some but they may be more. Thomas needs the status file in order to try to reproduce, but he's not available for a few days. You can report an issue and attach the job status  
10:12 <Denis> mflorea: is that file still available after upgrade, which one it is exactly ? Why the warning do a stacktrace ?  
10:13 <unknown\_\_> has joined #xwiki  
10:14 <mflorea> it would have been good if you had a backup of your data folder (as recommended :) ) so that you can take the job status from the back, in the data/jobs/status/extension/action/xxx  
10:14 <mflorea> s/from the back/from the backup  
10:15 <mflorea> otherwise the job status may have been overwritten so we might not be able to reproduce the issue  
10:16 <polx> has quit  
10:16 <mflorea> as for why a warning produces a stacktrace, I don't know, maybe Thomas didn't follow the logging best practice, which says that for warning we should log only the root cause message, not the stack trace.  
10:17 <Denis> ok, I have not made that backup presently since it was not a production server  
10:18 <Denis> I will try to reproduce on a pure test  
10:19 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
10:22 <ClemensR> btw just upgraded a test instance from 5.3 to 5.4.2 and that went smooth  
10:22 <vmassol> cool :)  
10:23 <ClemensR> so Denis problem is not a deterministic one, or it is 5.4.1 -> 5.4.2 specific ...  
10:24 <vmassol> it may also depend if your 5.3 was already an upgrade from a previous version  
10:24 <Denis> it was a fresh 5.4.1 in my case  
10:25 <Denis> it has not prevent from upgrading, it was just a warning, but the stacktrace was frightening  
10:27 <ClemensR> ah, I have not checked for warnings ...  
10:32 <ClemensR> no warnings here either, so it does not happen all the time  
10:42 <mflorea> has quit  
10:43 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:47 <vmassol> ClemensR: are you using —rebase when doing pulls? :)  
10:47 <vmassol> it seems you're adding a merge commit when you push  
10:47 <vmassol> I've noticed this a few times already  
10:47 <ClemensR> git fetch && git merge origin/master  
10:47 <vmassol> ok that's the issue then  
10:47 <ClemensR> yes, but how else ?  
10:47 <vmassol> it would be nice if you could use —rebase instead  
10:47 <ClemensR> ah, have to look this up  
10:47 <vmassol> git pull --rebase  
10:49 <ClemensR> ah, never know about that one - learn something new about git every day, thanks !  
10:49 <vmassol> yw  
10:50 <vmassol> ClemensR: I also wanted to thank you for your participation in the xwiki dev, it's great to see you so active every day! :)  
10:51 <ClemensR> thanks, but no need, I want to see less issues in XWiki too ... less complaints from our users, too :)  
10:51 <vmassol> yup  
10:52 <DarkKnightCZ> what exactly does "Awaiting committer feedback" mean (as pull request status in jira) ?  
10:54 <evalica> DarkKnightCZ: if for that particular issue there is a pull request, some committer should look at it and apply it.  
10:55 <DarkKnightCZ> evalica: yup, thanks  
10:56 <ClemensR> DarkKnightCZ:  if it is your pull request, then it is ok to push the issue in chat - I have figured out that this helps :)  
10:58 <DarkKnightCZ> ClemensR: yup, i've discussed it here with tmortagne a month ago, then he changed that to this status :) its XWIKI-3544 which practically breaks rendering cache  
10:59 <ClemensR> ah, ok, tmortagne is away for a few days, unfortunately  
10:59 <DarkKnightCZ> yep  
11:00 <polx> has quit  
11:00 <ClemensR> the trouble with the "big pull requests" is it takes more time to look at it, so it is necessary to be persistent about it ...  
11:04 <vmassol> this TC view is quite nice, you have JIRA integration: http://teamcity.xwiki.org/viewType.html?buildTypeId=XWikiCommons\_Default&tab=buildTypeIssueLog  
11:04 <Sidali> has joined #xwiki  
11:06 <ClemensR> DarkKnightCZ: btw I get "There are 65 checkstyle errors." when applying the pull request locally  
11:12 <DarkKnightCZ> ClemensR: thanks, going to check that... i remember i've turned checkstyle off, because i wasn't able to compile platform itself  
11:25 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
11:32 <DarkKnightCZ> ClemensR: by the way, i'm testing the distribution wizard on 5.4.2 now, on first run it had the same problem, but in stdout there were some warnings (cannot compare two attachments), so i found out my dev storage was out of sync with production... i've synced that and now it looks like it's working... three subwikis upgraded in a row without stucking  
11:33 <ClemensR> ah, ok, cool it is running smooth for far, keeping finger crossed that it continues that way  
11:46 <DarkKnightCZ> ClemensR: yep, it looks like it's working, 7 subwikis successfully upgraded, another 14 to go :) going to skip them and check extensions... there is just hell of a invocationtargetexceptions  (Couldn't instantiate the class for type with id 4012 on class class org.apache.poi.hslf.record.StyleTextProp9Atom), but i guess they are office-specific errors  
11:47 <ClemensR> meh, what is that ... happens while upgrading ?  
11:48 <mflorea> vmassol: Thomas broke Clirr with https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/3ff2ebbf4601870e7773191350ec76479b2230a7 . I don't understand exactly why is the change needed, so we have two options: revert or add excludes for http://pastebin.com/i74Hdb08 WDYT?  
11:49 <DarkKnightCZ> yep, but it might be problem with solr indexing (i use remote solr instance)  
11:50 <ClemensR> ah, yes, it needs to reindex everything after the update (I think)  
11:50 <DarkKnightCZ> yup  
12:44 <DarkKnightCZ> ClemensR: well, so far it works without problem, but just noticed "Successfully applied [UPGRADE] for extension [XWiki Platform - Panels - UI 5.4.2] on namespace [$escapetool.xml($argument)] from previous extension [org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-panels-ui-5.0]"  
12:46 <ClemensR> duh, no escapetool in the context when rendering the message ... or $argument is undefined  
12:46 <ClemensR> why didnt' I see that ...  
12:47 <DarkKnightCZ> i guess there is just typo somewhere :)  
12:48 <Sidali\_> has joined #xwiki  
12:49 <Sidali> has quit  
12:49 <Sidali\_> is now known as <Sidali>  
12:59 <ClemensR> DarkKnightCZ: did this "[$escapetool.xml($argument)]" happen for the main wiki or subwikis ?  
13:00 <DarkKnightCZ> if i remember correctly, it happened for global extension... logs should be in status.xml right?  
13:01 <ClemensR> yes!  
13:04 <Sidali\_> has joined #xwiki  
13:05 <DarkKnightCZ> well, it happened for global extensions (jobs/status/extension/action/...), this is part of status.xml - https://ezcrypt.it/Sd8n#2LjeAMXvDIKLmHv64CnQjPyg  
13:06 <Sidali> has quit  
13:06 <Sidali\_> is now known as <Sidali>  
13:06 <DarkKnightCZ> so it's more like problem with distribution wizard (<null/>)  
13:09 <ClemensR> ah, maybe  it is a null in there because the extension had no name in 5.0.3  
13:09 <ClemensR> at least it explains why I did not get the same message :)  
13:10 <DarkKnightCZ> yep, it's possible... enterprise UI had different artifact back then before 5.2, so i had to specify it on the first two pages  
13:14 <ClemensR> yes that platform-attachment-ui is new compared to 5.0.3, and the log message did not expect this and logged a null  
13:21 <DarkKnightCZ> hmm, any ideas why org.xwiki.wiki.internal.descriptor.DefaultWikiDescriptor.getWikiId() doesn't work in velocity? (or if there is better way how to get all current subwikis instead of $services.wiki.all)  
13:36 <vmassol> nice view: http://teamcity.xwiki.org/viewType.html?buildTypeId=XWikiCommons\_Default&tab=buildTypeChangeLog  
13:59 <polx> has quit  
14:09 <DarkKnightCZ> has left #xwiki  
14:14 <vmassol> guys please note that I've taken agent-2-1 offline for jenkins  
14:14 <vmassol> since I'm using it for TC now  
14:14 <vmassol> so please don't enable it :)  
14:15 <vmassol> (otherwise it'll cause conflicts, when running func tests for example or for VNC start/stop)  
14:24 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
14:27 <Sidali> has quit  
14:29 <Sidali> has joined #xwiki  
14:33 <vmassol> mflorea: IMO thomas is very wrong  
14:34 <vmassol> I really don't get it why he changed the package which was ok to something that is obviously wrong  
14:34 <vmassol> (just commented on https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/87a4519e74fadebbdad37e109d7d655e6755b167 )  
14:34 <woshilapin> has quit  
14:34 <mflorea> vmassol: I don't understand either, that's why I reverted, but then he put it back  
14:34 <vmassol> yep seen that and commented  
14:35 <vmassol> it still is wrong….  
14:35 <vmassol> it's still wrong  
14:35 <vmassol> I think we mixed up directory names with package names  
14:35 <vmassol> I created the "compatbiitliy" dir  
14:35 <vmassol> and the goal was a directory where to locate compatibiltiy aspects  
14:36 <vmassol> this was to separate it from other types of aspects we might want to be used like performance or logging aspects or...  
14:36 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
14:36 <mflorea> ok, we still don't know what problem he tried to fix  
14:37 <vmassol> not sure there's a problem to fix actually :)  
14:37 <vmassol> checking chat  
14:37 <Denis> has quit  
14:38 <vmassol> yes I think that's it  
14:38 <vmassol> someone removed the config I had put in the past  
14:38 <vmassol> http://mojo.codehaus.org/aspectj-maven-plugin/compile-mojo.html#aspectDirectory  
14:39 <vmassol> thomas probably removed it to use the default but he didn't remove the "compatibility" directory  
14:41 <vmassol> actually  
14:41 <vmassol> it's still set in some places  
14:41 <vmassol> in xwiki-platform-legacy for example it's there  
14:41 <vmassol>                 <aspectDirectory>src/main/aspect/compatibility</aspectDirectory>  
14:41 <vmassol> it's missing in rendering and probably commons, checking  
14:43 <vmassol> ok in commons devs have not used the compatibility directory  
14:43 <vmassol> nor in rendering  
14:44 <vmassol> so what thomas did is actually wrong IMO  
14:44 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
14:45 <vmassol> now in order to be homogeneous we just need to decide if we want to keep that directory or remove it  
14:46 <vmassol> since we're using specific moduels for legacy stuff I think we could remove it  
14:46 <vmassol> (and still be safe)  
14:47 <mflorea> I'm fine with both, but the current compatibility.\* package is strange  
14:48 <vmassol> it's definitely wrong  
14:48 <mflorea> so either keep the folder but not the package or remove the folder (and ofc the pacakge)
